articles.content:
Unabated struggle against introduction of U.S.-made fighters in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of proclaiming the second round of the intensive struggle against the introduction of U.S.-made fighters was reportedly held in front of the building of the "Ministry of National Defence" of South Korea on March 20 under the sponsorship of the council for national reconciliation and independent reunification, the people standing for peace and reunification and other organizations.
 The struggle, a follow-up of the first round of the intensive struggle held from march 6 to 9, is to be staged from march 20 to 29, during which strikes, demonstrations, rallies, etc. will be held everyday.

S. Korean trade union federation "outlawed"
articles.content:
S. Korean trade union federation "outlawed"
    Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The "Ministry of Administrative Autonomy" of South Korea on March 17 "outlawed" the newly formed South Korean General Federation of Trade Unions of public service workers and informed the prosecution of the list of its chairman and more than ten hardcore members, Seoul-based Radio No. 1 reported.
 The ministry ordered the chairman to appear at the Jungbu (central) police station of Jonju, North Jolla Province, till March 20 and instructed the relevant enterprises to punish other members.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea joint military exercises condemned
S. Korean-Japanese people's declaration made public
articles.content:
S. Korean-Japanese people's declaration made public
    Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The South Korean "people's action against investment agreement and the world trade organization" and a Japanese organization jointly made public a "declaration of South Korean and Japanese people" against the conclusion of the South Korea-Japan "investment agreement" on March 21, according to a news report.
 The declaration said the South Korean and Japanese authorities turned a deaf ear to the two peoples' strong opposition to the conclusion of the "agreement" and went so far as to round it off.    
 It said that the "investment agreement" sacrifices the South Korean people's right of labour, democracy and economic sovereignty in the interests of foreign investors and instigates the overseas sale and privatization of key industries including power and railway.
